Class SldAdvCard

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.model.advCards.sealed.SldAdvCard
Direct Known Subclasses:
SldAbandonedShip, SldAbandonedStation, SldCombatZone, SldEpidemic, SldMeteorSwarm, SldOpenSpace, SldPirates, SldPlanets, SldSlavers, SldSmugglers, SldStardust
public abstract sealed class SldAdvCard extends Object permits SldAbandonedShip, SldEpidemic, SldOpenSpace, SldSlavers, SldAbandonedStation, SldCombatZone, SldStardust, SldSmugglers, SldPlanets, SldPirates, SldMeteorSwarm
Represents an abstract sealed class for adventure cards in the game. This class provides common properties and behaviors for all adventure card types, while allowing specific implementations in its permitted subclasses. It enforces that subclasses must implement getCardName() and init(GameServer).

Many methods throw RuntimeException by default, indicating that a specific card type does not support that particular action or retrieve that specific information. Subclasses should override these methods if the functionality is applicable to them.

  • Constructor Details

    • SldAdvCard

      public SldAdvCard(int id, int level)
      Constructs a new SldAdvCard with the specified ID and level.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the card.
      level - The difficulty level of the card.

  • Method Details

    • getCardName

      public abstract String getCardName()
      Abstract method to retrieve the specific name of the adventure card. Each concrete card type must provide its own name.
      Returns:
      The name of the card as a String.

    • getState

      public CardState getState()
      Retrieves the current state of the card, indicating its phase in the game.
      Returns:
      The current CardState.

    • getActualPlayer

      public Player getActualPlayer()
      Retrieves the player currently interacting with this card.
      Returns:
      The Player currently active on this card.

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Retrieves the unique identifier of the card.
      Returns:
      The card's ID.

    • getLevel

      public int getLevel()
      Retrieves the level of the card, often indicating its difficulty or impact.
      Returns:
      The card's level.

    • getLandedPlayers

      public Map<Planet,Player> getLandedPlayers()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not involve landed players. Subclasses that manage landed players should override this method.
      Returns:
      A map of planets to players that have landed, if applicable.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card does not have any landed players.

    • getLines

      public List<CombatLine> getLines()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not involve combat lines. Subclasses that implement combat mechanics should override this method.
      Returns:
      A list of CombatLine if this card involves combat.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have combat lines.

    • getPassedPlayers

      public int getPassedPlayers()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not track passed players. Subclasses that track passed players should override this method.
      Returns:
      The number of players who have passed.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card does not have passed players.

    • getCrewNeeded

      public int getCrewNeeded() throws RuntimeException
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not require crew. Subclasses that require crew should override this method.
      Returns:
      The number of crew members needed.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't need crew.

    • getMeteors

      public List<Meteor> getMeteors()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not involve meteors. Subclasses related to meteor events should override this method.
      Returns:
      A list of Meteor objects.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have meteors.

    • getCannonPenalty

      public List<CannonPenalty> getCannonPenalty()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not involve cannon penalties. Subclasses related to combat or penalties should override this method.
      Returns:
      A list of CannonPenalty objects.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have cannon penalties.

    • getStolenGoods

      public int getStolenGoods()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not involve stolen goods. Subclasses related to theft or trading should override this method.
      Returns:
      The amount of goods stolen.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have stolen goods.

    • getGoods

      public List<GoodType> getGoods()
      Retrieves a list of goods associated with this card. By default, returns an empty list, as many cards do not involve goods. Subclasses that involve goods should override this method.
      Returns:
      A list of GoodType objects.

    • getCrewLost

      public int getCrewLost()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not result in crew loss. Subclasses that can cause crew loss should override this method.
      Returns:
      The number of crew members lost.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have crew lost.

    • getCredits

      public int getCredits()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not involve credits. Subclasses that affect credits (gain or loss) should override this method.
      Returns:
      The amount of credits.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have credits.

    • getDaysLost

      public int getDaysLost()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not result in lost days. Subclasses that cause time loss should override this method.
      Returns:
      The number of days lost.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have days lost.

    • getStrength

      public int getStrength()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not have a strength attribute. Subclasses involved in combat or challenges should override this method.
      Returns:
      The strength value of the card.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have strength.

    • getPlanets

      public List<Planet> getPlanets()
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not involve planets. Subclasses related to planet exploration or interaction should override this method.
      Returns:
      A list of Planet objects.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have planets.

    • init

      public abstract void init(GameServer game)
      Abstract method to initialize the card's state and context within the game. This method must be called immediately after drawing the card to set the game state to CARD_EFFECT and prepare the card for interaction.
      Parameters:
      game - The GameServer instance managing the current game.

    • applyEffect

      public void applyEffect()
      Applies the specific effect of the adventure card. Throws a RuntimeException if this method is called on a card that does not have a defined effect or if there's an issue with its implementation. Subclasses must override this method to provide their unique effects.

    • land

      public void land(Player player, int planetIndex)
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not support player landing on planets. Subclasses that allow players to land on planets should override this method.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player attempting to land.
      planetIndex - The index of the planet to land on.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't have a method to land players.

    • disegnaCard

      public void disegnaCard()
      Draws the visual representation of the card to the client. This method creates a VisualCard instance and triggers its drawing logic.

    • setState

      protected void setState(CardState state)
      Sets the new state of the card and notifies the game controller for updates.
      Parameters:
      state - The new CardState to set.

    • setNextPlayer

      public void setNextPlayer()
      Logs a debug message indicating that the "set next player" functionality is not implemented for this specific card type. Subclasses that manage player turns might override this.

    • comparePower

      public int comparePower(FlyBoard board, Player player)
      Throws an exception indicating that this card type does not implement a power comparison. Subclasses that involve comparing power (e.g., in combat) should override this method.
      Parameters:
      board - The FlyBoard context.
      player - The Player whose power is being compared.
      Returns:
      The result of the power comparison.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if this card doesn't implement compare Power.
